jparsec.astrophysics

Class Spectrum

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.Spectrum
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Spectrum
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class holds data like spectra or SEDs.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • spectrum

        public FluxElement[] spectrum
        Holds the spectrum/SED. The set of points should be given as flux as function of channel number to later create a Gildas spectrum.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Spectrum

        public Spectrum(FluxElement[] s)
        Simple constructor.
        Parameters:
        s - The SED/spectrum points. The set of points should be given as flux as function of channel number to later create a Gildas spectrum.

      • Spectrum

        public Spectrum(MeasureElement[] m)
         throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a set of values representing the spectrum, as intensities as function of channel number channel >= 1.
        Parameters:
        m - The intensities.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • Spectrum

        public Spectrum(Table table)
         throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a Table object. Intensities are taken from the Table object, while channel number >= 1 (ordered as in the Table following the indexes) is taken as x coordinate.
        Parameters:
        table - The table.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If it has more than 1 dimension.

      • Spectrum

        public Spectrum(java.lang.String[] s,
        java.lang.String separator,
        int xColumn,
        int yColumn,
        java.lang.Integer dxColumn,
        java.lang.Integer dyColumn,
        java.lang.String xUnit,
        java.lang.String yUnit)
         throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a spectrum defined as a string table.
        Parameters:
        s - The table.
        separator - Table separator.
        xColumn - The x column in the table, starting from 1.
        yColumn - The y column in the table
        dxColumn - The dx column in the table. A null value will produce 0 as result.
        dyColumn - The dy column in the table. A null value will produce 0 as result.
        xUnit - x units. To later create a Gildas spectrum set the x unit to null and use channel number for the x input data in the table, although velocity/frequency are also supported and conversion is done automatically.
        yUnit - y units.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the table contains no data or the input columns are invalid.

      • getGaussianSpectrum

        public static Spectrum getGaussianSpectrum(int np,
                           SpectrumLine line)
        Returns a perfect Gaussian spectrum given the parameters of the Gaussian.
        Parameters:
        np - The number of points in the spectrum.
        line - The fit to the line.
        Returns:
        The spectrum. The main parameters like reference channel and velocity, rest frequency, and velocity resolution are set.

      • getGaussianSpectrum

        public static Spectrum getGaussianSpectrum(double v,
                           double t,
                           double w,
                           int np,
                           double nu0,
                           double totalW,
                           double noiseLevel)
        Returns a Gaussian spectrum given the parameters of the Gaussian.
        Parameters:
        v - The central velocity, km/s.
        t - The peak temperature, K.
        w - The width of the Gaussian, km/s. The spectrum will have velocity limits from v - 2 * w to w + 2 * w.
        np - The number of points in the spectrum.
        nu0 - The central frequency, MHz.
        totalW - The total width of the spectrum in the velocity axis, km/s.
        noiseLevel - The level of noise. Set to 0 for a perfect Gaussian. The noise will be a random number between +/- noiseLevel.
        Returns:
        The spectrum. The main parameters like reference channel and velocity, rest frequency, and velocity resolution are set.

      • getAsTable

        public Table getAsTable()
        Returns this spectrum as a Table object in 1d.
        Returns:
        The table object.

      • getChart

        public CreateChart getChart(int width,
                   int height,
                   Spectrum30m.XUNIT xUnit)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart with certain spectrum.
        Parameters:
        width - Chart width in pixels.
        height - Chart height in pixels.
        xUnit - The unit for the x axis.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
